brief_summary.textblock:
This study is being done to obtain pathology reports from all patients in the Dent disease
      registry who have had a kidney biopsy. The investigator will collect the biopsy slides and
      reports in an attempt to determine if they have any common findings.

clinical_study.brief_title: Review of Kidney Biopsies of Dent Disease Patients

detailed_description.textblock:
If the patient agrees to be in the study, the patient will be asked to participate in the
      following:

        -  Sign a consent form indicating the patient's willingness to participate.

        -  Provide a signed medical release form allowing the investigator to request your
           official kidney biopsy reports, and also allowing the investigator to request the
           original slides for review. At the end of the study, all slides will be returned to the
           referring facility.

        -  The investigator will also review your medical record

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  All patients in the Dent Disease Registry with a previous renal biopsy.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  None.

study_pop.textblock: All patients in the Dent Registry with a previous renal biopsy

intervention.other_name: All patients in the Dent Disease Registry with a previous renal biopsy.

contact_backup.last_name: Mayo Clinic Rare Kidney Stone Consortium

clinical_study.official_title: Systematic Review of Clinical Biopsies of Dent Disease Patients

authority: United States: Data and Safety Monitoring Board

primary_outcome.description: The primary outcome will be to determine the number of glomeruli, percent globally sclerotic glomeruli, percent focally sclerotic glomeruli, and the severity of interstitial fibrosis (none, mild, moderate, severe) and interstitial crystals (none, mild, moderate, severe)

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Retrospective
